ratings.comment: Erin is great because she is young enough to connect with her students and still be involved in the media they interact with. My only concern was that there were unfair grading conditions. Great for someone who would rather write papers than take tests.

Erin was a great TV professor. She is extremely knowledgable on television and does a fantastic job connecting with students. Her fun and bubbly personality truly makes lectures and material more entertaining to take in. Going to lecture is recommended because there are pop quizzes. There are only two exams. If you are curious about TV, take this.
One of my favorite teachers, makes class so fun that you almost don't realize you're learning.  Doesn't talk about her boyfriend enough.  ;)

Erin is probably the best professor at the university.  She is very smart and young to the point where she can connect with the students so they will grasp the course content perfectly.  She keeps the lectures entertaining and gives occasional bonues to those who come to class.  Lecture is pretty much mandatory and she doesnt post lectures online.
Nice, Knowledgeable. Talks about her boyfriend alittle too much,
extremely funny and bubbly... she acts like she's your friend and makes class fun

Erin was the best TA ever! Even though she was random at times, she was always enthusiastic and cared about the material in section.  She was also a pretty good (and by that I mean relatively easy) grader.
